data.title: Oldest 3 Hours+ Films
data.meta_description:
Which film longer than 3 hours and released before 1950 is your favorite?

Rule: At least 1000 votes

Note: Superhero serials excluded

Discuss here (https://community-imdb.sprinklr.com/conversations/imdb-poll/poll-suggestion-oldest-3-hours-films/606b6120740aa414da7233a2)
data.text:
The Stoneman family finds its friendship with the Camerons affected by the Civil War, both fighting in opposite armies. The development of the war in their lives plays through to Lincoln's assassination and the birth of the Ku Klux Klan.

An intrepid reporter and his loyal friend battle a bizarre secret society of criminals known as The Vampires.

Arch-criminal Dr. Mabuse sets out to make a fortune and run Berlin. Detective Wenk sets out to stop him.

A railway engineer adopts a young girl orphaned by a train crash. Years later when she starts getting suitors, he grapples with whether or not to tell her the truth about her parentage.

A drunkard priest who has been cast out by his community struggles to atone and regain his honour and dignity.

The lives of numerous people over the course of 20 years in 19th century France, weaved together by the story of an ex-convict named Jean Valjean on the run from an obsessive police inspector, who pursues him for only a minor offense.

A sheltered and manipulative Southern belle and a roguish profiteer face off in a turbulent romance as the society around them crumbles with the end of slavery and is rebuilt during the Civil War and Reconstruction periods.

The legendary Forty-seven ronin plot to avenge the death of their lord, Asano Naganori, by killing Kira Yoshinaka, a shogunate official responsible for Asano being forced to commit seppuku.
